alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 8:10PM EDT until August 16 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Cummings and Fechtig east to Walterboro, Hendersonville and Gloverville. As much as 1 to 3 inches of rain could fall through 1015 PM, resulting in minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. - A Flash Flood Warning remains in effect for northeast Colleton County and far western Dorchester County until 930 PM. Please refer to that bulletin for more information. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Yemassee, Cottageville, Ritter, Hendersonville, White Hall, Round O, Early Branch, Drawdy, Thayer, Neyles, Lowcountry Regional Airport, Colleton Medical Center, Gloverville, Salkehatchie, Parkers Ferry Landing and Davidson.
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
